translated: As It Was Said🔽The Collection of Threes🔽The third sub-chapter

original: Vuttañhetaṁ bhagavatā vuttamarahatāti me sutaṁ:🔽“Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.
analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta  diṭṭhāḥ mayā bhikkhave sattāḥ kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā
translated: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One:🔽“Monks, I have seen beings who, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world, because they had right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā
translated: Having seen this, I say that there are beings who, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world, because they had right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: Taṁ kho panāhaṁ, bhikkhave, nāññassa samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā sutvā vadāmi.🔽Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.
analyzed: tam kho pana āha bhikkhave na aññassa samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā sutvā vadāmi  diṭṭhāḥ mayā bhikkhave sattāḥ kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā
translated: But I don’t say this because of not knowing or seeing.🔽I have seen beings who, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world, because they had right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā
translated: Having seen this, I say that there are beings who, with the breakup of the body, after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world, because they had right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.”

original: Api ca, bhikkhave, yadeva sāmaṁ ñātaṁ sāmaṁ diṭṭhaṁ sāmaṁ viditaṁ tadevāhaṁ vadāmi.🔽Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.🔽Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā”ti.
analyzed: api ca bhikkhave yat eva sāmam ñātam sāmam diṭṭham sāmam viditam tat eva aham vadāmi  diṭṭhāḥ mayā bhikkhave sattāḥ kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā  te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati
translated: But I say that what is known by oneself, seen by oneself, realized by oneself, is to be asserted.
Monks, I have seen beings who, with the breakup of the body, after death, have been reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world, because they possessed virtue.
This is the meaning that I expressed when I said:
having spoken rightly and acted rightly,
having done all that is to be done,
one is here called a person of right.
The one of much learning who does good
after the breakup of the body, the wise one

is reborn in heaven.’🔽This is the meaning that the Blessed One expressed when he said: ‘This is the meaning that I expressed when I said: “I know and see “; this is the meaning that I understood when I said: “I know and see.”‘🔽This is what the Blessed One said.🔽This is what the Blessed One said.

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti 🔽dutiya
translated: This, too, is the meaning of what the Blessed One said.
